title: Genotype Polymorphism effects on Typhoid Vaccine responses.

producedBy.name: Genotype Polymorphism effects on Typhoid Vaccine responses.

affiliations.name: TCG-ISI Centre for Population Genomics, India

usesReagent.name: 96 well filter bottom plates 50 per pack
1250ul tips 10 refill racks of 96 per rack
96 well round bottom plates 50 per case
Formic acid in 1mL ampoules, sequanal grade
Salivary Blood Contamination Enzyme Immunoassay Kit

values: Using a stratified random sampling design, 1,000 participants receiving vaccine to S. typhi will be recruited from eight strata (two age groups [< 25 years, > 25 years], two gender, and two ethnic groups [Hindu, Muslim]). Stratum sample size will be proportional to total stratum size.
Subjects are unrelated to the first -cousin level.
Persons with previous infections-determined from ongoing surveillance study with a complete census of the population.
Additional exclusion criteria include: current fever or diarrhea, pregnancy, and lactation.

values.value: The objective is to understand role of polymorphisms in genes of innate and adaptive immunity in modulating the response to vaccines for two gastrointestinal tract infections: typhoid and cholera.  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18571127

primaryPublications.authorsList: Staats HF(1), Kirwan SM, Whisnant CC, Stephenson JL, Wagener DK, Majumder PP.
primaryPublications.title: Development of a bead immunoassay to measure Vi polysaccharide-specific serum IgG after vaccination with the Salmonella enterica serovar Typhi Vi polysaccharide.

primaryPublications.authorsList: Zaccaro DJ(1), Wagener DK, Whisnant CC, Staats HF.
primaryPublications.title: Evaluation of vaccine-induced antibody responses: impact of new technologies.

availability: Available for download after registration with ImmPort

dimensions.description: Small scale resequencing using the Sequenom platform is performed on exons, exon-intron boundaries, and promoters on genes with SNPs showing association with immune response in Typhoid Vaccine Study. Resequencing is performed on 100 samples and genotyping using the genetic variants that are identified by the resequencing of the remaining samples. To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.
Measurement of cytokine in saliva samples  and serum samples  collected before (day 0) and after (day 3, day 28) vaccination using a multiplex bead assay in and Cholera Vaccine Studies

Determine response to vaccination through measurement of serum anti-Vi polysaccharide IgG in day 0 (pre-vaccination) and day 28 (post vaccination) samples using a bead assay in Typhoid Vaccine Study.  Analyses were performed on participants with an adequate quantity of biospecimen

Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis separations of serum permits identification and quantification of proteins associated with immune response in Typhoid Vaccine Study.  Spots selected from that gels showing association are picked for protein identification using mass spectrometry.
Saliva samples from subjects are stratified and analyzed by gender, age, ethnicity, time point, and response to vaccination to anti Vi polysaccharide.

SNP analysis (Sequenom and Illumina) of innate and adaptive immunity genes in the Typhoid Vaccine Study based on selection of SNPs by investigator-define algorithm. Analyses were performed on participants with adequate, high quality DNA available. To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

SNP analysis (Sequenom and Illumina) of innate and adaptive immunity genes in the Typhoid Vaccine Study based on selection of SNPs by investigator-define algorithm. Analyses were performed on 997 participants with adequate, high quality DNA available. To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

Proteins from 2-D gel experiments are identified by excising the idividual spots of interest, performing an in-gel digest using trypsin, extracting the peptides, analysis via LC-MS/MS, database searching, and statistical analysis.
Transferrin levels were determined using ELISA assays to determine the level of blood contamination in saliva from the Typhoid Vaccine Study subjects
Detect and quantify levels of defensins among subjects selected for proteomics investigation in Typhoid Vaccine Study.  Subjects were selected for low and high response to vaccination.

distributions.title: Genotype Polymorphism effects on Typhoid Vaccine responses.

description: Innate immunity gene products are known to be the first-line of host-defense and to control and assist the adaptive immune system. This research represents the opportunity to study, in detail, the responses longitudinally to vaccination (using clinical examination and laboratory assays) in a large ethnic population. Consequently, a prioritized set of genes and gene products from both systems will be evaluated.
